name: 林碧雲
objective: This course aims to give students a sound foundation in the concepts of sociology and tools used to analyze social issues.  It begins with a brief introduction of sociological theories and then follows by the case discussion of various topics in the modern society.  Students are expected to exercise their sociological imagination to explore current global or local social conflicts and submit their contributions on a selected issue.
schedule:
Week 1 : Course Overview
Week 2-3 : Understanding Sociology & Sociological Research 
Week 4-5 : Culture 
Week 6-7 : Socialization and the Life Course 
Week 8 : Social Interaction, Groups, and Social Structure 
Week 9 : Midterm Exam 
Week 10 : Deviance and Social Control 
Week 11 : Stratification   
Week 12 : Social Mobility
Week 13 : Racial and Ethnic Inequality
Week 14 : The Family and Intimate Relationships 
Week 15 : Religion 
Week 16 : New Year Holiday
Week 17 : Social Change
Week 18 : Final Exam
scorePolicy:
Attendance and Class Participation : 40%
Midterm Exam : 30% 
Final Exam : 30%
materials: Richard T.Schaefer  (2013 ), Sociology: A Brief Introduction. McGraw-Hill.  10th ed.
